Description: Wooden shabti of Djymyr covered in a layer of painted plaster with a short blue and black lappet-wig with yellow braids, a brown face with black features, representations of black ear-studs, a yellow and black collar with a decorative blue tasselled border, brown crossed hands in relief with one holding a single yellow hoe, the front of the legs are inscribed with seven rows of black incised hieroglyphs separated by red lines, the body is white(now discoloured), the back is decorated with a red and black representation of a seed-basket hanging from one shoulder, the whole figure is thickly varnished.
